message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. It's a unique opportunity to get a great deal on a high-quality item. I'm willing to sell it to you for $150.
I'm interested in the product, but $150 is a bit steep for me. I'm willing to pay $120 for it.
I understand you're looking to save some money, Bob. However, the product is worth more than $120 to me. I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $135.
I'm still interested in the product, but $135 is a bit too much for me. I'm willing to pay $115 for it.
I'm still not willing to go as low as $115, Bob. However, I'm willing to make another concession. I'll meet you at $130, which is a bit closer to your target, but still a good deal for me.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short on budget. I'm willing to pay $125 for the product.
I'm getting close to my minimum price, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $128, but that's as low as I can go. If you're still interested, this is my final offer.
I'm still interested in the product, but $128 is getting close to my limit. I'm willing to pay $122 for it, and that's my final offer.

I'm not willing to go any lower than $128, Bob. I'm starting to think that you're not serious about buying the product. I'm going to make one final offer: $129. If you're not willing to meet me at this price, I'll have to consider other options.
